subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The Indianapolis Colts hope to have tight end Dallas Clark back for Sunday’s game against Miami for the first time since he injured his right knee five weeks ago. Clark, wearing a brace, practiced yesterday for a second consecutive day, and Coach Tony Dungy said he expected Clark to play against the Dolphins. He had sprained his anterior cruciate ligament Nov. 26 against Philadelphia. Through the first 11 games, Clark had 26 receptions for 311 yards and 4 touchdowns.
